articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets General Secretary of Lao Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets General Secretary of Lao Party
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Sunday sent a message of greetings to Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the party.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you and, through you, to the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and all the Party members on the occasion of the 55th founding anniversary of the LPRP.
					
					 Over the past 55 years since its founding the LPRP has led to victory the struggle of the Lao people to consolidate the independence of the country and build a prosperous new society.
					
					 Under the correct leadership of the LPRP headed by you the Lao people are now registering great successes in the defence of the country and economic construction through a dynamic drive to implement the decisions of the 8th Congress of the LPRP.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I wish you greater success in your responsible work for strengthening of the party and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and countries will continue to develop on good terms in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Iranian President
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, president of Iran, on the occasion of Iran's New Year.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the Iranian president good health and happiness in the New Year, too, and him and the people of Iran greater success in their work to defend the sovereignty and security of the country from the obstructive moves of the hostile forces and build powerful Iran.

articles.title: Officials Visit Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Officials Visit Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials, chief secretaries of the provincial committees of the Workers' Party of Korea and leading officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions visited the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex Sunday.
					 The workers of the complex are overfulfilling monthly plans through a dynamic drive to increase the production of iron and steel by displaying the popular heroism and the persevering offensive spirit under the torch of great surge kindled by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung in Chongjin City and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Visiting the complex, they went round the room for education in the revolutionary history and the room devoted to the history of the complex.
					
					 Seeing the revolutionary relics and data, they deeply felt the great efforts and undying feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu who devoted their all to the development of the nation's metal industry.
					
					 Then they went round the Second Steel Shop, the Steel Ingot Shop, the Hot-Rolling Shop, the Hot-Rolled Product Finishing Shop, the Second Oxygen Shop and other places seething with the drive to increase production true to the on-the-spot teachings of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Imperialists' Rhetoric about "Protection of Human Rights" Flayed
articles.content:
Imperialists' Rhetoric about "Protection of Human Rights" Flayed
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The imperialists and their mouthpieces are talking about the theory of "human rights without border" and "priority to human rights", but it is nothing but sophism intended to use the human rights issue as pretexts for aggression and plunder, interference and pressure upon other countries and nations, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a signed article.
					 The imperialists' ballad of "protection of human rights" is a reversed theory of man-killing and a call for aggression, war and intervention, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The imperialists are the primary enemies of human rights as they interfere in the internal affairs of other countries under the signboard of "protection of human rights" while violating the sovereignty of independent countries.
					
					 There can never be the only "standard of human rights" suited to all the countries.
					
					 However, the imperialists raised their "standard of human rights" as "criterion" and are forcing other countries to approve it.
					
					 Their mouthed "protection of human rights" is the pronoun of aggression and intervention.
					
					 The imperialists are working hard to tarnish the image of progressive and socialist countries and isolate them internationally, taking issue with them over the "human rights issue".
					
					 They have encroached upon the sovereignty of legitimate independent states and mercilessly violated the national dignity and human rights. Nevertheless, they are describing their crimes as actions for "providing freedom and democracy". This only brings their brigandish nature and shamelessness into bolder relief.

articles.title: US Cruiser Enters S. Korea
articles.content:
US Cruiser Enters S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Shiloh, a cruiser of the U.S. navy, entered Mokpho Port in South Jolla Province of south Korea on Mar. 18, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The bellicose forces declared that the cruiser, together with warships of the U.S. 3rd Fleet, will be involved in the military exercises of various missions such as "defense of sea lanes" till March 23.
					
					 It is the first time that the cruiser entered south Korea.

articles.title: Repression Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement on Thursday denouncing the puppet authorities for their violent suppression of its member.
					 The statement referred to the fact that the Kyonggi provincial police office walked off Hong Kap Phyo, ex-chairman of the Society for National Spirit who is advisor to the solidarity, on the charge of violation of the "National Security Law" and searched his house on the same day.
					
					 The police repression was committed under the groundless pretext that he "encouraged and praised the north", it pointed out, deploring that the case has made the people feel once again that anyone can neither say nor write as wished in south Korea as long as the NSL exists.
					
					 The statement stressed that the organization would wage vigorous struggle to stop the suppression of the progressive figure and get the NSL abrogated.

articles.title: Concern Voiced about Move to Discriminate against Korean Schools
articles.content:
Concern Voiced about Move to Discriminate against Korean Schools
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The UN Committee on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination, in a report related to the enforcement of the agreement on eliminating racial discrimination in Japan on March 16, recommended the Japanese government to conduct a fact-finding survey of foreign schools and various other schools and urged it to take measures against any discrimination in education.
					 The report expressed concern about calls for excluding the Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools, terming them "acts of discriminating against children's education."

articles.title: Japanese Gov't Urged to Include Korean Schools in Tuition-free Program
articles.content:
Japanese Gov't Urged to Include Korean Schools in Tuition-free Program
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Liaison Council for Demanding Denuclearization and Peace in Northeast Asia and Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK, an organization in Japan, sent a letter to the authorities of the government on Feb. 28 in protest against its moves to exclude the Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools.
					 It is stipulated in the Japanese Constitution and the international treaty that nationality, identity and individuality of foreigners and minority should be respected in any part of the world, the council in the letter noted, saying: There is no reason for the Korean schools to be excluded from the tuition-free program as they are an institution providing the children of Korean residents in Japan with education.
					
					 It stressed that such wrong attitude as discriminating against the Korean residents, a group of the community in Japan, for no reason can never be helpful to realizing the normalization of the relations between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					 The right to be educated as wished is universal right recognized by the world, the organization said, strongly urging the government to include the Korean schools in the tuition-free program in the spirit of friendship.

articles.title: "Kim Jong Suk Library" Founded in Peru
articles.content:
"Kim Jong Suk Library" Founded in Peru
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The "Kim Jong Suk Library" was founded in Peru.
					 The library is stocked with works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books introducing the immortal feats of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk and the advantages and might of the socialist system in the DPRK.
					
					 A ceremony of opening it to visitors took place at the building of the Peruvian People's Women Union on March 13.
					
					 The general secretary of the union said at the ceremony that the library is named after Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, in order to make all the Peruvian women model on her who made great contribution to the Korean revolution and the development of the women's movement.
					
					 It is the greatest feat of Kim Jong Suk that she brought up Kim Jong Il as the prominent leader of the Korean revolution and thus provided sure guarantee for the future of Korea, the general secretary said, adding: The library will be greatly conducive to the activities of the union for building a democratic, new society and awakening of the Peruvian women.
